# Welcome to The Red Line

::: {.hero-banner}
### A Living Memory of the HIV/AIDS Epidemic

This storytelling experience walks through the past, present, and future of the HIV/AIDS crisis through impactful data visualization and narrative. 

Ultimately, this interactive project strives to educate, destigmatize, and inspire pragmatic action by visualizing how queer communities responded with power and purpose when the world turned them away. 

:::

## The Past
### New York Case Study
Follow the history of HIV/AIDS in New York City, the epicenter of the early epidemic in the United States, where activism, tragedy, and resilience shaped the response.

[View New York Case Study](new_york.qmd)
:::
:::{.intro-card}
## The Present
### Misconceptions
Explore the common misconceptions surrounding the disease today and the impacts of the epidemic, examining how different communities and regions have been affected by HIV/AIDS over time.

[View Misconceptions](misconception.qmd)
:::
:::{.intro-card}
## The Future
### PEPFAR's Global Impact
Learn about the President's Emergency Plan For AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) and its role in addressing the global HIV/AIDS crisis through international cooperation, and the hold it has on the future.

[View PEPFAR Analysis](pepfar.qmd)
